meanings.definition: To renounce or repudiate under oath
meanings.sent1: He had to forswear his allegiance to the king in court.
meanings.sent2: She decided to forswear lying and always speak the truth.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would forswear his love for pizza for a salad.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the princess had to forswear her royal title to save her kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The knight had to forswear his sword to prove his loyalty.

meanings.sent1: The villain would forswear his innocence to deceive the hero.
meanings.sent2: It is never right to forswear the truth, even in difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child would forswear his mischief to avoid punishment.
meanings.sent4: The con artist would forswear his intentions to gain the trust of his victims.
meanings.sent5: The false witness had to forswear his testimony when the truth was revealed.

meanings.definition: To give up or deny something
meanings.sent1: She had to forswear her favorite dessert to stick to her diet.
meanings.sent2: He would never forswear his principles, no matter the temptation.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to forswear his magic wand for a day as a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The explorer had to forswear modern comforts during his journey in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to forswear sweets to maintain peak performance.
